revised_title: Investigating the Arrangement of Excitable Fibers in the Internal Capsule of Bonnet Monkeys
tldr: This study investigates the arrangement of excitable fibers in the internal capsule of bonnet monkeys (Macacus sinicus) to understand the relationship between the fibers and the basal ganglia. The authors expose the internal capsule through a horizontal section and use a minimal stimulus to record the movements. They find that the movements are arranged in the same way as observed in the cortex, with the representation of extension situated in front of flexion for the upper limb segments and toes.
